body_html:
Although I don't have a multi-GPU server, the code fails with the following error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File ".\test.py", line 137, in <module>
    model = queue.get()
  File "multiprocessing\queues.py", line 113, in get
    return _ForkingPickler.loads(res)
  File "torch\multiprocessing\reductions.py", line 167, in rebuild_storage_filename
    storage = cls._new_shared_filename(manager, handle, size)
RuntimeError: Couldn't open shared event: <torch_21084_2878318007_event>, error code: <2>

Looks like it is missing in sth like #5585. We only considered the transmit of the tensors but that of the models was left behind.

Thank you for your kind reply.
Now I know I mistakenly used Torch.Multiprocessing.Queue.
I will change code to return tensors rather than models, thus this is not an issue anymore.

body:
> Although I don't have a multi-GPU server, the code fails with the following error:
> 
> ```
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File ".\test.py", line 137, in <module>
>     model = queue.get()
>   File "multiprocessing\queues.py", line 113, in get
>     return _ForkingPickler.loads(res)
>   File "torch\multiprocessing\reductions.py", line 167, in rebuild_storage_filename
>     storage = cls._new_shared_filename(manager, handle, size)
> RuntimeError: Couldn't open shared event: <torch_21084_2878318007_event>, error code: <2>
> ```
> 
> Looks like it is missing in sth like #5585. We only considered the transmit of the tensors but that of the models was left behind.

Thank you for your kind reply.
Now I know I mistakenly used Torch.Multiprocessing.Queue.
I will change code to return tensors rather than models, thus this is not an issue anymore.
